description: From Latin accendō (“I kindle, light (a fire)”)  +‎ -ible (compare Italian accendibile).

adjectives.description: accendible (comparative more accendible, superlative most accendible)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Capable of being inflamed or kindled; combustible; inflammable
examples: Every combustible requires a peculiar pitch of temperature to be kindled , called its accendible point
